Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR OUR NEEDS”
Reviews.Author: SurferRyan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as it was somewhat close to the airport in a safe neighborhood. The room was nicely appointed, clean, and comfortable. Nice shower supplies and an amazingly comfortable bed - we both slept like rocks. The continental breakfast was great, and even included some hot items. Free internet access in the lobby. Complimentary valet parking.... all in all, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for families visiting North LA and Santa Monica”
Reviews.Author: lightyearz
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, free Internet, and breakfast. Free parking, nice Jacuzi and good location for Hollywood attractions.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lozza428
Reviews.Content: Room was satisfactory and very clean, nice big beds and decent breakfast. Location is not the nicest in terms of neighbourhood, but it was very handy for bus lines to Santa Monica and Venice Beach. There was also a bus that went into downtown LA, very easy to navigate the local bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff walking distance to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: nurse024
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week ago. All of the staff is friendly and helpful. Room was clean and breakfast an upgrade from usual continental fare. At 9 AM the egg dish was empty and when brought to the attention of the server she immediately and graciously brought a new dish. Breakfast was served until 10 with coffee and fresh water available throughout the day. We walked to Norm's restaurant and Apple Pan on Pico which was lined with a nice variety of restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice, convenient, be aware of the minimal downside”
Reviews.Author: vegascarroll
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, bathroom tiny. Staff was nice, noise from Sepulveda ungodly. I liked the free valet parking, did not try the free breakfast as I had to leave before 7:00 am start time. This sems to be a good middle of the road choice for the area. Location is very convenient and gives you great access to a lot of things. If you're a light sleeper, which I am not, the traffic noise may be a problem. As others have said, immediate neighborhood is not great but surrounding area is great and you can walk to some cool restaurants on Pico. Beds were very good, room was clean. Restroom is for a single user who is not claustrophobic, providing only a shower in my room. You can get a drink of water from the faucet and just about turn on the shower while you're sitting on the toilet (that's how small the bathroom is), but the room was clean, in nice condition, and the linens/towels were nice as were the in room toiletries. A good choice for a mid-priced stay in an area that has some very expensive lodging options.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas E
Reviews.Content: I found everyone at the Best Western Royal Palace very helpful during my stay and they seemed to go out of their way to make sure I was well taken care of, and I also like the location close to everything in Westwood, Century City and Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A real bargain for the price. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast more than acceptable, really quite good for continental. I will be back. The neighborhood is marginal but I liked the location for its convenice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: jcummingsNYC
Reviews.Content: We traveled from NYC to LA for a Xmas to New Year's trip and stayed in a suite with 2 queen beds that had a small sitting room with an additional TV. The room had a microwave and fridge that came in handy for keeping late-night snacks. Breakfast was the usual toast, cereal, muffin, fruits, coffee, tea type of thing but it was almost impossible to get a seat. Coffee and tea are available 24/7 and there were always cookies available in the afternoons. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was immaculate. The bathroom was on the small side with the lowest sink I have ever seen in any hotel. The sink height was just over my knees. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. A big thank you to Fred (at the front desk) who goes above and beyond and helped us with directions and recommendations on the highlights to see in the area. You will definitely need a car to stay at this location. There were many restaurants that were only a 5 minute drive away. The hotel is right by the 405 and the drive to the Santa Monica Pier and Venice beach were an easy 10 minute trip. The hotel offers free valet parking which turned out to be a big plus as everywhere you went it was $10-$20 to park. I would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay again on my next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SteMur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in December and I was very happy with my stay. I had a room with a King bed which was very comfortable and although the room looked a little dated, it had everything I needed including a large LCD TV, Fridge, Microwave and most importantly a safe which was big enough to hold all my valuables as well as a laptop. The location was great, not too far from the airport and it is close to many shops and restaurants. Parking was not a problem as there is free valet parking. Breakfast was in the hotel lobby but it was fine for starting the day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: aweiler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November of 2011. The hotel is staffed around the clock and there are parking attendants watching your vehicle and valet service available 24-7 as well. The neighborhood was nice, and the drive to anywhere we wanted to go was within a 1/2 hour. The rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable. The FREE breakfast and FREE parking are what turned me onto this hotel in the first place. When I actually got to LA I realized what a blessing offering free parking and breakfast is, since everything seems to be expensive and hard to find where parking is concerned. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting the Burbank/Los Angeles Area on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not "Royal"”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSunMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our needs. We picked it because it has "suites" which includes a separate sitting room (with a door). This was perfect for us with our small child. We brought a pack and play and put it in this room. Then we didn't have to tip-toe around our room when she was sleeping or napping. The rooms are clean, but dark. They are small and have a lot of furniture in them. The bathroom is small, but the closets are huge. The continental breakfast had a large assortment of food and fit our needs. It was a good value for what it is, but it is not a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: MyriamMaas
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, with special props to Fred. Valet parking is complimentary, the location is great for all the tourist attractions and places you'd want to visit. Breakfast is in the hotel lobby, but that didn't bother me. There's more than enough to start your day off. I would definitely stay here again. It's not a 5 star hotel, but you get the 5 star service!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate choice”
Reviews.Author: Huggles77
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in L. A. we stayed here. The room was fine with losts of closet space but the bathroom was sooooo narrow and small, it was ridiculous. Small but adequate breakfast as well. Frontdesk attendant, Fred, was great...he helped out with a lot of answers to our questions and had a good sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Champagne Taste, Beer Budget”
Reviews.Author: Playaman47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a long weekend in L.A. based at this property and found it to be an excellent choice ... moderately priced, super-clean and comfortable room, friendly staff and better-than-average continental breakfast. The huge bathroom would benefit from another overhead light. We were in a room at the back of the property that insulated us totally from the noise of Sepulveda.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs - great value”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiz
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a couple and to save money we stayed in two roomed units where we could. This property offered us the main room with two comfortable queen beds, two huge cupboards, in room safe, TV, with a small but perfect bathroom; great water flow and plenty of hot water. A small separate lounge had a fridge, coffee maker, TV, drawers, a single pull out convertable couch and access to a small terrace which met my needs. The mattress was a little thin, but we robbed the spare bed! Fred, at the front counter, was very helpful and all the staff friendly. The breakfast was varied and while not the most healthy, set us up for site seeing. The afternoon cookies were a tasty suprise. The location was great for the 5 days site seeing we did in Santa Monica and Hollywood, with the bus stops close by. It was a 10 minute walk to the Westwood Pavillion mall, with many eating options along the way. Norms was a favorite; $10 got us soup, salad and a steak dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to client, shopping and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: nobs-pdx
Reviews.Content: I was on business between Jan-Jul and stayed at BW because it was within walking distance of my client, a shopping mall and many restaurants. The rooms had microwave and refrigerator so I was able to grocery shop and have my own snacks at nite. Staff was very pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel and we we,ll be back”
Reviews.Author: Kallamokan
Reviews.Content: We best location for us. Staff members are very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Not so satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Hashim84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 5 different locations of Best Western in Canada, I can say that Best Western Canada is much better than this location. When you enter the room, you can feel it's humid with slightly bad smell. The air conditioning is not so good. The internet is very weak or no connectivity. Let me tell you the positive side: I liked that the breakfast is open till 10 am (though the space is very limited).. The room was very big and they offered us a baby crib for free. The room came with a refrigirator and microwave... and we had parking spots (on the road in front of the hotel) everytime we arrive and it's for free. The price of the stay is very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn027
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this property and would especially like to thank, Fred, for his exceptional customer service! He graciously allowed us to change rooms to a quieter one and was most helpful with providing information to us and sending an item to me which I forgot in the room. We will definitely stay here again and will also report to friends and family. Evelyn Haas

Reviews.Title: “impossible parking, won't return unless resolved”
Reviews.Author: momlovestotravel2011
Reviews.Content: The positives: friendly front desk staff and housekeeper. Good working A/C and flat screen TV. Simple breakfast. Clean, basic towels, linens. Non-smoking policy. Free internet. Microwave, mini-refrigerator, hairdryer, coffee maker in room. The negatives: Exercise machines broken except for weights. Steam sauna not working. Hallway carpet stains. Parking area impossible - narrow & steep. Adjacent street parking wasn't available when I needed it night or day.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: thkosan
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and was fairly sure that I would be happy with this hotel. I am pleased to tell you that it was far superior than I expected. Our room was very clean and updated with marble walls and granite surfaces in the bathroom as well as granite surfaces in the room itself. The shower was roomy, the water pressure high and the bed was SO comfy! I chose this hotel because I wanted a suite with two televisions so that my daughter could watch cartoons while I watched more adult-oriented fare. The television in the bedroom was a crisp flat-screen, but the second one in the living area was an older conventional style with less that stellar reception. But my daughter didn;t mind -- she was able to see her cartoons just fine. I don't know if all of the bathrooms in the hotel have sinks as low as ours was, but my daughter loved being able to use the sink herself without standing on her tippee toes. She's in kindergarten. I found it to be to low for an average sized adult, however. I used the small exercise room every day. It was equipped with a weight station, a step climber, a stationary bike and a treadmill. Although the stationary bike and the stair climber were in okay condition, all of the items in the room were a bit dated and the elevation mechanism on the treadmill was broken. There is a large TV in the room, a water dispenser, and a sauna across from the bathroom. Down the hallway is a small room with a pool table in it. The breakfast was the best I've had at a Best Western. In addition to a variety of breads, fruit and cereals, there was also single-serve wrapped english muffin and sausage sandwhiches in a warming oven along with hot, soft granola bars. We ate very well every morning. A particularly nice touch was the warm cookies that were set out for guests in the afternoon. The hotel staff were exceptionally nice. My rental car broke down as we were leaving to go to lunch. As we waited in the lobby the receptionist brought my daughter water and heated-up english muffin egg and cheese sandwich. I visit Los Angeles every year and this is the fourth hotel I've stayed at in four years. From now on I will always stay here. For just over $100 you get free high speed internet, a swimming pool, a hot tub, an exercise room, a good breakfast, free parking and nicely updated rooms with very comfortable beds -- WOW! Such value and quality at this price point just can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Macfred123
Reviews.Content: The room was a suite, a small conventional Hotel Room with another small room attached. There was a problem with television reception. The bathroom was cramped. Everything was clean, though, and we slept well. We checked out after one night when we had booked two nights. Everyone was friendly, and the breakfast was fine. Parking was difficult as described before.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the kittens”
Reviews.Author: Nani1807
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. The room needed a better cleaned. The problem that we had wad the people at the front desk wasnt polite. I was doing my laundry in a locked room and when i came back, my clothes were all over the room. Someten at the frontdesk gave the spray key to other guest and he/ she took my cloth away from the washer machine. Then while i was waiting inside the lobby some couple came in, but they didnt looked like a loving couple, it was more like a kittens were all around.

Reviews.Title: “The bare basics”
Reviews.Author: adkc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a layover for our trip to Fiji - really good for the value, you get all the basic amenities, nothing more nothing less. Beds are clean, bathroom was clean, the breakfast was decent (can't expect 5 star eggs benedict). The parking lot was small and tight, they just need to change the carpetting in the hotel and in the room, it was old and yucky.. all in all, good value if you need a place to stay overnight to go somewhere else in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: kristi14
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to an event we were attending. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was a mini-suite with a separate living room area. The only drawback is that the underground parking had a VERY narrow driveway and was difficult to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Davidedetta
Reviews.Content: we stayed in los angeles for 3 nights, this best western is really good value for money. The hotel is extremely clean and the staff is very kind. We had free parking and internet!!!! the only negative thing is the position, but it's in a safe part of the city. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Marquis_J
Reviews.Content: SUPERFAST, FREE internet access and by far the best I have experienced in the USA or Europe. Great room and like a HAVEN after two substandard motels on a PCH road trip.

Reviews.Title: “better then expected”
Reviews.Author: london2135
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early from LAX and wasn't allowed to check in as the room was not ready however can not blame the hotel as check in was not until 3pm. Staff did offer us breakfast and offered to call a taxi to take us to the beach if we wanted. Hotel itself is basic but did include a small pool area, mini gym and free breakfast. Free parking is decent however as others said not a huge amount although I believe street parking was free. Breakfast was fairly basic but above average I would say, did have a good selection mainly bagels, toast and cereal. Room was huge really spacious as was the bathroom which had a large jacuzzi bath. TV included HBO and cable. Plenty of storage and seating area with chairs. Was well maintained by room service who restocked bathroom supplies and tea and coffee. Staff were helpful and had good knowledge of area and were always welcoming. Only minor downside would be perhaps the location not awful if you have a car however we did not which meant it took about 20 mins to venice beach via the bus and around a hour to hollywood. Bus was easy to use though. Local area is a little run down but perfectly safe went out day and night and had no problems. 3 blocks away there was a cvs and vons also. In terms of value what I would say is I got a cheap rate through expedia for £60 total which was great however their standard pricey did look a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: ciphershock
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with sufficient parking. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The bathroom is big. Nice staff. A good breakfast in the morning. Over all a good place to stay for the price paid. The internet is a bit slow though.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: spinninginvertigo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently during a trip to Los Angeles for a conference, and was very pleased with my four-night stay. I was on a strict budget and it almost goes without saying that this is no-frills style of accommodations, but the room was extremely clean and comfortable (and spacious--though I believe I was upgraded), and that was most important for me for this type of trip. The largest problem I ran into was the commute back to the hotel in the afternoon/early evenings from downtown, but the distance and inevitable traffic was amply compensated by the free parking (and for two cars, no less), free wi-fi and the complimentary continental breakfast. Unfortunately I didn't have the chance to try many of the amenities (I didn't even turn on the television in my room!), but would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and Fred was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RuffLilDancer77
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my Mom and my Dad. This was so close to Rodeo Dr and the Santa Monica Pier. Also, it was only about 30-40 minutes from the Aquarium at the Pacific (Long Beach) where we went Whale Watching and the Dolphins swam right with the boat. Also, not far from the Hollywood Park Casino. At the hotel, the rooms were great, we had two Queens and a pull-out couch (pretty comfortable) with a T.V. as well. Fred at the front desk was so funny! "I don't look like Fred, but I am Fred." LOL! The continental breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Studio9
Reviews.Content: Live in Las Vegas; booked a double queen room for out-patient UCLA Med Center surgery due to other Tripadvisor references. Not a fancy or large hotel but was an easy 2 mile drive to the Med Center. Turned out to be a great choice. Staff was super-nice and upgraded us to a king suite on the back side of the hotel so it would be even quieter. The pillow-top king bed was very comfortable, and the separated suite rooms were appreciated. Complimentary breakfast was great; the staff even asked how the surgery went. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and close to UCLA but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: tedlew
Reviews.Content: Having two children who are students at UCLA requires occasional lodging in the area. This property is 2 miles from campus and has fairly roomy suites and it is the least expensive name brand hotel in the area. But....the property is pretty old, and has many aspects that do not compare with other hotels in the area. While the rooms are sizable and decent, it just feels old and dark, as there doesn't seem to be sufficient lighting. The bathroom is downright claustrophobic and ours did not have a tub, only a shower. The walls are very thin and you can hear every creak and step from upstairs. Also the parking lot is so cramped it is a hassle to negotiate. I would not stay here again if I could help it. The breakfast is fair. The staff is nice enough...it is just the property itself that leaves much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not very central”
Reviews.Author: bridan90
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very pleasant and have to say that the staff were extremely kind and helpful. We had a small suite which was basic but very clean. The outdoor pool is tiny but since we were only really using the hotel as a base that didn't bother us too much. The downside is that unless you have a car you are quite a good distance away from central LA and it's numerous attractions and our personal experience was that the public transport left a great deal to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty dirty DIRTY!!!”
Reviews.Author: cassdawg8008
Reviews.Content: I am a flight attendant so I have a lot of experience in the hotel department and this is the worst I have seen yet. Yes the beds were comfortable although the do sink in the middle so if you aren't sleeping alone you will be sleeping at a funny angle. As soon as we walked into the building there was a terrible smell. To me it smelled like a mixture of smoke and mold. VERY tiny bathrooms. No bath tub, just a small stand up corner shower. My biggest turn off to this place was when we were leaving the room I was gathering up my final things and a maid pushes past me and walks over to the bed and pulls off the blanket. Im not talking about the one on top that everyone knows never gets washed, Im talking about the thinner one under that. I watched her take that blanket across the room and disappear into a different room. I was hoping maybe this was a laundry room but I had to check and when I did, I SAW HER PUTTING THAT BLANKET ON A FRESHLY MADE BED!!!!! Disgusting. Who knows who had that blanket before me OR before that person. How long do these people go without washing things. Do they do this with the sheets as well?? I DO NOT suggest staying at this hotel. It is chceap for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “The staff set this hotel above the rest!”
Reviews.Author: mkinsley
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in Los Angeles recently, I needed a place to stay for a week. My girlfriend and I selected this hotel because it was right around the corner from who we were visiting, and it had free high-speed internet in the rooms. Honestly, although the room that we stayed in was a suite, it was on the good side of average. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, but otherwise it was unremarkable. The hotel is near the 405 freeway (and can be a bit noisy depending on your room), and the 10, which makes traveling convenient. I would have happily stayed at this hotel again, but I don't think that I would have bothered to write a review. What really set this place apart from anyplace else that I have ever stayed, was the staff. Arriving in town late at night, and needing to work from a room in the morning (I needed to stay somewhere with wi-fi), the desk clerks set me up for an extremely early check-in the next day. The hotel manager also went out of her way to accommodate my business needs beyond any of my expectations. I have never been anyplace that really seemed to care about their guests more, and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, but not exactly great.”
Reviews.Author: WLAMom
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed there a couple of weeks ago due to its proximity to our house which was being worked on. We stayed 4 nights, and it was not too bad. Although we pretty much just slept there, we found the room to be spacious, fairly clean, albeit dark and stuffy. The bathroom was clean but very very small - no counter space! And the shower was just plain weird (no tub) but clean. The bedspreads (we had 2 beds) did not look that clean, so I examined the blankets and sheets closely. Found a few gray hair in the blankets! Yup. Sure did. I quickly asked for clean flat sheets to cover our blankets. Oh, and I pulled off the bedspreads entirely. The next day and went home and took our beddings with us. I know this is not an option for most people, but because I could, therefore I did. The breakfast was buffet style and consisted of bread and bagels which you can toast yourself, pasties, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee & tea. Although it wasn't the greatest, it was good to have. In the evening they serve fresh baked Otis Spunkmeyer cookies, and we enjoyed them, of course. The parking was not too bad, but the spaces are small and narrow. The hotel was not full that week so we always found a space, but it would be hard if it were full. The pool was very small and didn't look that clean so we never used it. The evening clerk was extremely nice and responsive. Had a problem with the remote and the repairman came very quickly. The day staff was so so. Housekeeping was okay. Don't know if they change the blankets and bedspreads with each guest, and don't know if the hair simply got stuck to the blankets even after washing (which happen sometimes). Since I brought our own beddings, I didn't want anyone to mess with our beds so I asked them to only remove the trash and replace the towels, and they were happy to oblige. Would I stay there again? Probably if we had work done on the house again, but I'll remember to bring my own comforter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: travelloverz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I still can't believe what we had for the price we paid! The room was HUGE, absolutely wonderful with the comfiest bed ever! Everything was so clean, looked new and the bathroom was so big and beautiful! The breakfast was also a wonderful surprise. Didn't expect that at all. We paid about 100$ more (for 3 nights) than another hotel we had stayed in and felt like we were in a 5-star hotel compared to the other one. The bus was only a couple of blocks away and it took us to Santa Monica Beach in about 15 or 20 minutes. The neighborhood was lovely and we felt totally safe. We really loved it! There's nothing else to say...

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: kiwinz_7
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for a very good price through hotwire. on reading reviews I was a bit nervous as to what we may find. We loved it - it was not a flash hotel with the trimmings but it gave us everything we needed with the best beds we slept on in 7 weeks travelling. The bathroom was small, however the shower was great - hot and great pressure. the staff were helpful and friendly especially Celeste. We hired a car and found this hotel to be within easy reach of the sights. Some good restaurants nearby within 10 minutes walking and a shopping centre with supermarket and takeaway food outlets.For the price we paid I was very happy

Reviews.Title: “average stay...a few minor issues, could be major for some”
Reviews.Author: Buffgrl
Reviews.Content: We originally chose this hotel for it's reasonable price, amenities, and location. (close to Venice beach, Hollywood, etc.) Below I'll provide the pro's and cons: Pros: *Reasonably close to major attractions *Reasonably priced *Standard continental breakfast *Really, REALLY comfortable beds and pillows. Linens are standard. (I think these beds are a Best-Western standard as every Best Western I've stayed in has these wonderful beds and pillows) *Rooms decently appointed- fridge, television w/cable, etc. (However, there was no ironing board or hair dryer.) *Pleasant decor- updated except for the showers. *Plenty of hot water. Cons: *Noisy nights. The walls seem paper thin- we could hear our neighbors' televisions, coughing, laughing, and people coming in and out of their rooms all night. And if you like to sleep in a little, forget it because you can hear the maids getting to work early. *Really weird parking situation. The parking lot is really hard to get in and out of through a single narrow driveway. You have to be really careful not to scrape your car on the sides. If you have a large vehicle, there is a sign warning you that if you get in, you will have trouble getting out. There are a few spaces available on the street, but not many. *Staff could be friendlier- staff seemed mostly bored and unmotivated. *Yucky stuff that the maid missed under the sink in the bathroom, as well as some stuff on the toilet behind the seat.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay”
Reviews.Author: agnesb_15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, an OK overall impression. The rooms are very big, and clean. The location is good (between Santa Monica and Hollywood). Breakfast is not good though...

Reviews.Title: “An O.K. Stay”
Reviews.Author: cabe26
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice in our trip. The first week, they put us on a second floor room and it was fine. Microwave and refrigerator, no noise at all, although the door trembled everytime someone in the other rooms closed their doors. The hotel has a great location, great breakfast, friendly staff and we found good spots to park our car in the hotel parking. The second time we were there was only for a night and we got a first floor room. Someone tried to break in and we could hear everything the people in the room above us was doing during the night so that we couldn' t have a good night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: paracels
Reviews.Content: We arrived to LA from Europe late afternoon and stayed in the first night in this hotel. We read the reviews here and I have to say the place met all our expectations. The staff was warm and helpful. Room was very clean and reasonably large and bed was just perfect. On the other hand, A/C was a bit old and noisy, so forget about using it during the night. Breakfast options were a bit limited (we missed some hot dishes) but still good. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Better than imagined!”
Reviews.Author: melvettalee
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about this hotel at first, because I won it through Priceline and didn't know anything about it. I started doing research and was somewhat impressed, but not as impressed as when I walked into the room. A friend and I stayed for 5 nights in a Suite with two very comfortable queen beds, a nice seperate sitting area, and clean, up to date accommodations, including free Wifi access which works like a charm. The staff was pleasant, the area was very quiet and peaceful, and even other guest there were friendly. The continental breakfast wasn't extensive, but it was sufficient for getting your day started. We were nearby Century City, Beverly Hills, and other sightseeing areas. In my opinion, this hotel deserves more than 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is a challenge, otherwise an ok motel”
Reviews.Author: flash_tsquare
Reviews.Content: We booked here strictly because of the location and would probably have looked elsewhere had we known about the parking situation. Parking is tight. Very tight. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite and happy about that. We were very happy with the room, although the bathroom was a little cramped. Internet access was possible only with an wi fi amplifier. At 3:00 they had two at the desk, one of which worked and provided a nice solid connection. There aren't any restaurants withing easy walking distance, and the parking situation makes driving to a restaurant an unwelcome option. We ordered out. There aren't a lot of other local choices, but I'd try to find someplace with better parking and a nearby restaurnat.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in the area”
Reviews.Author: bilz
Reviews.Content: When the best parking option is street parking, you know it's not good, but that doesn't even come close to describing the parking mess you'll find here. There are two parking lots, one is above ground and has about eight spots. It's a dead end lot so while getting in can be doable, getting out is a mess, as you have to manuever the other cars as well as the uncomfortably close walls of the hotel. Once you leave, you have to go out on to a busy street and your view will be blocked on both sides by the lucky guests who were able to find street parking. If you have to park in the underground lot, you have to manuever through other cars, poles, garbage, the ceiling (!), as well as the unsafely steep one way ramp that leads down to the parking structure. If you are entering when someone else is trying to exit, you'll either have to reverse up a narrow hill with walls on both sides or hope the other person will reverse downhill into parked cars. It's going to be an accident either way so just hope for the best. Once you get into the hotel, assuming you even make it that far, you'll probably have to try a few times before you get a clean room (i've stayed here twice and was shown to a dirty room both times). Then you can plug in your computer and if you're lucky enough to get a computer signal (I could on one of the 4 days I was there) it will not be "high-speed." I actually got a faster connection using the phone line. You can try to complain to the front desk but they'll just tell you to call a 1-800 help line that will just tell you that the problem is on the hotel's end. The only nice thing about the hotel is the location, although there is absolutely NOTHING within walking distance or even short driving distance, you can reach all of the LA destinations without having to pay the typical LA prices. There is one guy that works at the hotel that is very nice but most of the workers could really care less about you. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Ramada down the street. It used to be a Holiday Inn Express, it has good parking, and it's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: bitbytravelbug
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3:15, and were upgraded to a suite at no charge. However, the room was not ready, and we had to sit in the lobby until 3:45. We were offered another room after about 10 min., but declined as we wanted a king size bed. The suite itself wasn't bad, but the industrial carpeting was coarse underfoot, and the bathroom had a tiny "half shower" only, and a sink that was set so low that I, at a little over 5 feet, had to bend considerably to use it. The paint was peeling off the ceiling as well. The biggest problem we encountered was that the heating unit didn't work. It was a combo a/c-heater and only blew cold air, even after running for 10 min. Because we got back to the room late, we threw the quilted bedspread back on the bed and slept OK. Everything people had said about the parking situation is true; it can be done, but you must maneuver very slowly. In the morning, we did apprise the front desk of the heating situation, and they immediately sent someone to check it out. They also said they were aware of the peeling paint in the bathroom, and that was also scheduled to be fixed. In conclusion, this hotel was OK for a one night stay, considering it was under $100/night and parking was free. Just go with those expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, big rooms, horrible parking”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: The hotel had perfectly nice rooms, quite large, ours hand a sort of funny "back room" with a second TV, microwave, fridge, and sofa bed leading onto a balcony. It's hard to describe without seeing it, but it looked like the front rooms of some of those all-suite hotels that normally sit by the front door, except that this was in the back of the room. It almost seems as if they had planned to make street entrances in the back and then changed their mind. Room was clean, bathroom had a mini-tub and shower, so the "tub" is a bit bigger than a stall shower, but an adult couldn't soak in it. Free wirelss internet worked well, hotel was very clean. Parking was awful. The lot is under the hotel and is entered by a steep driveway that requires a tight right turn. The space is not open - it has poles, walls, etc, that make many of the already few spaces very tough to get into. Best for a small car with a passenger who can get out and guide you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mochad
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our vacation, and we both thought it was a great motel for the price. It's a Best Western, so you can't expect the same amenities as The Four Seasons. :) Our room was huge (as was our bathroom!). Housekeeping came faithfully every day and did a good job. The parking lot in back is on the small side, but we rented a Subaru Outback for our trip and had no trouble manuvering our car in and out. (One word of caution: if you get back to the motel too late at night, it's very likely the lot will already be filled up. But you can park on the street -- we were able to get a spot right out front) The front desk staff was very helpful and always had a spot-on answer for any questions we had, whether it was on how to avoid L.A. traffic, to where you could find a good bottle of wine. All in all, I'd definitely recommend anyone traveling to L.A. to give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and Cold Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lucky2livemaui
Reviews.Content: We got in after a long 6 hour flight, and our bags were stuck in the carousel at the airport, by the time we got to the hotel it was close to midnight. Then we find out the parking was "down the street", which wasn't that far, but inconvenient, it certainly was not in front of your room. Turning into the parking lot, it was a stuggle just to get the car in there, no wonder they had tons of scapes along the walls. We requested ground floor, we were tired, cold and hungry as there was no food service on flight - only snacks. they didn't have a ground floor, so we hiked our 4 (heavy) bags up the flight of stairs because there was no elevator. Already getting more upset, we got into the room and although it probably was a 10 x 10 space, it sure felt like a 7x10, it was tiny. We then could hear luggage being dragged up the stairs and making loud noise coming up, it was by then nearly 1am. We called to tell the front desk we were checking out in the morning originally planned 3 nights there. Our 1am neighbor was doing the same thing we did that next morning. The front desk seemed not to care, and never asked if there was a problem. They said fine. I don't think we'll be back. We checked into the Ramada down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all...”
Reviews.Author: coquicola412
Reviews.Content: Yuck... Okay, just got back from a 3-night stay at this motel. Let me first say that it is very convenient to many things, and is just a few blocks off of I-10. Not in the best neighborhood in the world, but still, relatively convenient. The front desk staff was nice when we checked in, and explained everything, as well as the free continental breakfast and where to park, and the best places to get to your room. Let me move right on to parking........as others have mentioned, it is HORRIBLE. We were driving a minivan, and were basically excluded from parking underground because they said our van wouldn't fit. There is a small amount of parking in front of the hotel, which is very tight. However, there's also a small parking area to the south of the hotel...a little bigger, but also very hard to manuever with a van. Parking is limited, so you'd better be back by about 7 pm! Otherwise, you'll have to spend a night parking on the street like we did. So...taking our keys, and having parked our car, we walk up to our room...a "suite". TINY! We had two queen beds in the sleeping room, and an additional room tacked on with a tv, couch, refridgerater, and microwave. The additional room couldn't have been more than 10ftx10ft. Although, we found we needed it so we'd have room for a suitcase or two as there isn't much room in the sleeping room for anything other than the beds, desk, and tv. One of the smallest rooms I've honestly seen. The air conditioning placement is HORRIBLE......right under the window, next to one bed. It's impossible to have the room cool without turning it on high at the coldest setting. It doesn't shut on or off by itself, so you have to leave it on high all night.......which means that the unlucky person (me) sleeping in the bed next to it gets an icy wind blown on them all night. The bathroom........................THE-SMALLEST-BATHROOM-IN-THE-UNIVERSE! And horribly constructed. First of all, the sink is short enough to comfortably accomodate a midget. There is enough counter space to maybe, just maybe store a tube of toothpaste on it. Oh, and I LOVE how the faucet is on the side of the sink....right next to an electrical outlet that has the hairdryer plugged into it. The shower is rediculous! Not only is it tiny, with ever changing water temperatures.......it also has a bizarre step in one corner that prevents anything but your head being hit by the water. Why they have this step area is beyond me. It prevents you from using that corner of the shower, which is needed. So, ladies, trying to shave your legs with the foam of your soap is impossible because a stream of water from the shower hitting your head drains down and rinses the soap off as soon as you lather it on....not to mention, you must fight with the shower curtain sticking to you the entire time. The lighting in the bathroom is horrible....there's a heat lamp that makes it intollerable when on after a shower because of the heat and humidity. The only other light is a florescent light, which makes you look horrible even with the best makeup job. The towel racks are placed right over the toilet, which is really dumb. We even had an incident where a washcloth fell into the toilet. Needless to say, we didn't realize this until a member of our party used the toilet and it tried to overflow when she flushed (luckily she thought to turn off the water...I can't imagine the mess if she hadn't done this). So, we called for maintenance. Apparently, there was "nobody on property to help us........but we have a plunger you can use". So, to make the long story short, WE got the toilet fixed and WE fished out the toilet water washcloth and threw it away. What a horrible place to put towel racks. The absolute only counter space is also located directly above the toilet. Needless to say, we kept the toilet seat down out of fear that a personal item would fall into the great beyond. Hmmm.........let's see....a good thing...quite a nice sized balcony. It looks out over the road, and the traffic didn't bother us. Housekeeping always seemed very good. We never really ran into any staff, but the room was always cleaned very nicely. The hotel does have a continental breakfast daily 7am-10am. They have cheerios, corn flakes, bagels, toast, coffee, juice, fruit, and tea. There's a computer in the lobby which I didn't use. There's a bunch of brochures in the lobby which is very helpful. The hotel does have a pool and jacuzzi, which both are pretty small, especially the pool. Neither looked appetizing at all to me. So................the wrap-up.........................we won't be back. The hotel is just too frustrating. There's more negatives than benefits. I just didn't like it, and couldn't wait to leave. Yes, it's cheap, but you could find much better hotels for the exact same price. PICTURES SOON TO COME....

Reviews.Title: “A Low End- Budget Motel Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THE PROS; cheaper than most of LA’s motels @ $79/nite GOOD VALUE; SERVICE was good & helpful; neighbors & traffic noise were not heard.; THE CONS; this is an Older motel, not a “Palace Suites” ; our family of 5 [3 sons @ 13, 13, & 15] needed 2 :suites. A motel worker’s tile cutter noise lasted until 6pm—until we complained to the front desk. PARKING was cramped & difficult to maneuver underground. LOCATION; This part of Sepulvda Blvd is mostly industrial— but 3 blocks to I-405; 12 blocks to Venice Beach; ----BEST TRIP ADVICE; Get a GPS trip device with your rental car—saves stress & time!-----

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: momofsk8rs
Reviews.Content: This hotel had terrible parking. Probably the worse I've seen. The breakfast was average but I have to say this - the people who worked here really made this hotel highly recommendable. They went out of their way to help us from early check in to finding a "safe" Walmart, Target and Kmart. The rooms were clean and the suite was large and comfortable. The location was perfect for anyone going to West LA, and Santa Monica. It was a good value when you consider the cost of other hotels in the Santa Monica area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is worth it”
Reviews.Author: sioFont
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, not far from Santa Monica nor West Hollywood. Also well connected by public transportation (bus) with LA airport and Santa Monica. Hotel is not very clean, but it isn't dirty. Isn't very comfortable, breakfast isn't excellent, people in front desk aren't too nice, but you can't ask for more by paying this rate (there are a kitchenette and wireless internet connection not very expensive). Neighbourhood not seems unsure for a single traveler. Some shops and restaurants, even a shopping center, at a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cut my leg, badly, on a jagged piece of metal on the bed frame (I have a scar). I reported it to the person at the front desk, and was met with complete indifference, not even a thank you or apology. I had to call housekeeping to get someone to fix the problem, so that the next guest wouldn't be at risk.

Reviews.Title: “Id rather stay at a Truckers Iinn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The customer service was horrible. There was a leak in my room and wet spots on the floor. The front hotel clerks were very unaccomadating. Id rather stay at a truckers inn alongside a highway

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Suite has two rooms, two double beds and sleeping sofa, two TVs, fridge and microwave, parking is free, rooms are clean, there are no ants or other insects, staff is polite, neighborhood feels safe, price is low, where is the catch? There is only shower stall in the bathroom, the cooling is done by window a/c, the getting in and out of garage is very tricky, the neighborhood feels safe but there is nothing there, breakfast offering is very modest. Overall, I consider it a very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “BW is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a terrific bargain for the price. The rooms weren't very as fancy as one would expect from a "palace" but they were very clean and relatively large. The hotel is in a nice residential neighborhood where you feel safe taking a walk. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and professional. My only drawback is the tight parking lots. Park on a side street if can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Suites include two tvs, refrigerator, microwave. We had a very large closet and a small closet. We had a balcony with a couple chairs and small table. Most of the hotel staff were very nice and helpful. The room was great for a family. The parking below the hotel was VERY tight and difficult to get in and out, even with the lot mostly empty. Parking on the street was easier, but limited. Continental breakfast was more limited than what I was used to, but was satisfactory. Only two tables near the breakfast area, which was adequate when we were there.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Royal Palace Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2528 South Sepulveda Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90064
